text:
- Steve Miller, I lead
enterprise partnerships at Miro.

Generative AI is absolutely
transforming the world,
but certainly software,

and what we see is a lot
of interest and engagement

from our customers on
the power they believe
that gen AI can bring to their business,
but they don't know where to start.

And so one of the things
we're really helping to do
is bring gen AI-powered workflows
into what they're doing already today.
How can they accelerate
bringing a new product to market faster
rather than trying to boil the ocean?

But I think it's really
in the early stages
and hard to know what comes next.

The biggest misconception
about generative AI
amongst the public, I would say,
is I think people don't understand

how much it can help them
in their daily lives,
especially in their personal lives, right?

I think that's one of the most
interesting elements of this
for the general public is
how much easier their life can be
when they start to work with gen AI.

We manage a lot of these
different dimensions of gen AI,
and I think a very pragmatic way.
Our AI teams have built out
a really foundational internal platform

that not only allows them to
build new AI-powered features,
but also the rest of our organization.

And so what they do is they
really spend a lot of time

establishing who are the
vendors we wanna work with
and how are we gonna deploy those,

but then giving tools to
all of our engineering

and product teams so that they
can innovate super quickly
in their part of the product.

And of course, we're
doing quite a bit with AWS
on that front.
(upbeat music)
